intro: Heteropterys escalloniifolia f. parvifolia, commonly known as the dwarf leaf huito, is a compact shrub native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, characterized by its showy, often showy flowers and hairy foliage. The plant features small, ovate leaves that are typically densely arranged along the stems. Its flowers are usually pink or red, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. This variant is distinguished by its smaller leaves compared to the typical form, making it a sought-after ornamental plant in subtropical gardens.
